**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/81551
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ndk.2303+240@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution
**Device used:** Windows 11 Home/Chrome
**App Component:** Left Hand Navigation (LHN)

## Action Performed:
Preconditions:
- Account in default/Most recent mode
1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Navigate to SelfDM
3. Create an expense
4. Navigate away SelfDM
5. Navigate back to SelfDM

## Expected Result:
What would you like to do with this expense? should be shown under SelfDM in LHN

## Actual Result:
'What would you like to do with this expense?' disappears on LHN when navigate away and back SelfDM

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Action Performed:
Precondition: 
1. Use new Expensifail account
2. The user does not have workspace
3. User have Self-DM 
Steps:
 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Click the + global create button, select "Track Distance", and go to the "Manual" tab
3. Enter a valid distance and click "Next"
4. Select the user’s email address(Personal) as the recipient
5. On confirm page, observe Rate row is not clickable

## Expected Result:
"Rate" option row in confirm page should be clickable & clicking on it should display the Upgrade pge

## Actual Result:
Rate field not clickable if destination is self DM and no workspace during manual track distance flow

Unknown

**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** MacOS Monterey 12.7.4 / Chrome
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
Precondition2: 
1. Sign up new account in OldDot. Return to OldDot again after navigating to NewDot. 
2. Create Worksapce, open DevTools console and run:
var settings = NVP.get('travelSettings') || {};
settings.testAccount = true;
NVP.set('travelSettings', settings);
3. Enable Travel feature in worksapce > More features

STR:
1. Start one-way flight
2. Complete the booking flow on https://staging.travel.expensify.com/
3. Open workspace chat

## Expected Result:
There're 2 expenses:
one of the expenses is for the price of the flight
one of the expenses is for 15$
Both expenses have receipts and the details match to what was booked

## Actual Result:
No expenses in worksapce chat

## Workaround:
Unknown

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!

**Version Number:** v9.3.20-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory around https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/68134
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.78+ck216261@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Win 11/Chrome, Pixel 8a/Android 16
**App Component:** User Settings

## Action Performed:
1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Create a workspace
3. Go to Account >> Wallet
4. Click "Add bank account"
5. Start adding bank account on the workspace or in the wallet (Make Payments option)
6. Exit the flow on any of the step
7. If you're not on the Wallet page, go to the Wallet
8. Click partially added bank account (with Action required badge)
9. Verify that the page with Continue Setup appears
10. Click Continue Setup
11. Verify that you can continue the setup from the step you left
12. Tap app back button until you reach Confirm currency and country page
13. Observe blank currency/country fields displayed
14. Go back & click Start Over >> Yes, start over on popup
15. Select Log into your bank
16. Observe blank currency/country fields displayed

## Expected Result:
Currency/Country fields should not be blank when navigate back from step left for partially setup BA

## Actual Result:
Blank Currency/Country fields when navigate back from step left for partially setup BA

## Workaround:
Unknown

title: Add inline editing for tables on desktop

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
For our desktop tables we want to edit inline editing to allow users to quickly edit certain fields. Here's a rough demo followed by more detailed specs underneath: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ece98b01-8eeb-4b06-bd4c-584cc3e607d8 Here are some interaction specs: The cells are: - 32px tall - 8px padding left and right - 8px border radius Go for the specs written above as the video prototype is just to indicate the general interaction patterns. The editable fields to start with should be: - Date - Merchant - Description - Category - Amount (not currency, only number) cc @Expensify/design @trjExpensify @JmillsExpensify

## Action Performed:
1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ (or production)
2. Navigate to any **DM chat** (not workspace/policy chat)
3. Create a new expense without specifying a merchant (leave merchant field empty)
4. Click on the created expense to edit it
5. In the merchant field, enter **"Expense"** or **"(none)"**
6. Click Save
## Expected Result:
DM expenses should reject invalid merchant values or display saved values
## Actual Result:
1. **No validation error** - "Expense" or "(none)" saves successfully
2. **Merchant not displayed in list** - The merchant field shows empty in expense details

Unknown

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @justinpersaud **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771080908183879) ## Action Performed: 1. Set a daily category limit of $15 CAD 2. Charge an expense near the limit (e.g., via Expensify Card in foreign currency) 3. Ensure the displayed CAD amount is slightly below the limit (e.g., $14.98 CAD) 4. Submit/view the report 5. Observe violation ## Expected Result: If the displayed amount is $14.98 CAD, no over-limit violation should trigger. ## Actual Result: Expense displays $14.98 CAD. Report shows an over-limit violation for exceeding $15 CAD. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
1. Login with new Expensifail login
2. Create new workspace, toggle Expensify card feature ON, invite new member
3. Setup bank account for use Expensify card

Steps:
1. Go to WS > Expensify card
2. Click "Issue card"
3. Select Member
4. Follow the flow until magic code page, enter magic code
5. Verify the new card was issued
6. Repeat steps 2-5 to issue a 2nd card

## Expected Result:
Magic code is required to issue each new card

## Actual Result:
Magic code is required only when issuing the first card after login. No magic code is required for other cards.

Unknown

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!

**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Samsung S23FE/ Android 16
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
Preconditions: 
User A is a new user created on https://staging.expensify.com by selecting "Organize my own expenses". The "Get paid back from my employer" option was selected from the intent selector during the onboarding flow.
In NewDot, create a valid scan expense and submit it to a non-existent account (User B).

1. Go to User B's email inbox
2. From the email with the subject "Please pay expense", copy the link "open it in Expensify" (can be found in the footer) 
3. Change the link to staging and navigate to it
4. Go to the expense details
5. Tap on Pay $X.XX > Pay with business account
6. Tap on Log into your bank account
7. Complete the Plaid flow
8. Approve the expense
9. Tap on Pay $X.XX
10. Navigate to the Concierge chat

## Expected Result:
The onboarding tasks are displayed for manage my team expenses.

## Actual Result:
Some onboarding tasks, like "Take a test drive", "Connect your corporate cards", and "Set up categories", are missing.

## Workaround:
Unknown
